contentrichtext.text: Four ships of the [[Royal Navy]] have been named '''HMS ''Hermione''''' after [[Hermione (mythology)|Hermione]], the daughter of [[Menelaus]] and [[Helen of Troy|Helen]] in [[Greek mythology]]. * {{HMS|Hermione|1782}} was a 32-gun [[fifth-rate]] launched in 1782. Her crew mutinied in 1797 and handed her to the Spanish. She was recaptured in 1799, renamed HMS ''Retaliation'', and renamed again to HMS ''Retribution'' in 1800. She was broken up in 1805. * {{HMS|Hermione|1893}} was an [[Astraea class cruiser|''Astraea''-class]] [[protected cruiser]] launched in 1893. She served in the [[World War I|First World War]] and was sold in 1921. * {{HMS|Hermione|74}} was a [[Dido class cruiser|''Dido''-class]] [[light cruiser]], launched in 1939. She was sunk in the Mediterranean by the German submarine [[German submarine U-205|''U-205'']] in 1942. * {{HMS|Hermione|F58}} was a [[Leander class frigate|''Leander''-class]] [[frigate]] launched in 1967 and scrapped in 1997. ==References== *{{Colledge}} {{Shipindex}} {{Italic title prefixed|3}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hermione, Hms}} [[Category:Royal Navy ship names]]
